00059 //! Initialize the PPIDD parallel environment
00060 /*!
00061  *  - For \b GA, includes initialization of TCGMSG/MPI and GA.
00062  *  - For \b MPI2, calls MPI_Init.  
00063  */
00064    void PPIDD_Initialize(void) {
00065 #if defined(MPI2) || defined(GA_MPI)
00066 
00067       fortint ifor,lenmax=256;
00068       int i,j,argc=0;
00069       char **argv = NULL;
00070       char arg[256];
00071       int mpierr;
00072 
00073   #ifdef MOLPRO
00074 /* For molpro, enable the function of getting command line arguments */
00075 /* if iargc_ and getarg_ have been defined, then use them to
00076   construct the argument list by calling FORTRAN. 
00077       extern int  iargc_();
00078       extern void getarg_(int*,char*,int);
00079 
00080    Otherwise, use external functions and subroutines from molpro FORTRAN wrappers
00081    to construct the argument list */
00082 
00083       extern fortint molpro_iargc_();
00084       extern void molpro_getarg_(fortint *, char *, fortint);
00085 
00086    /* ========================== *\
00087       Get command line arguments
00088    \* ========================== */
00089       argc=(int)molpro_iargc_();
00090       if(argc) {
00091          argc++;
00092          argv = malloc(argc*sizeof(char*));
00093          for(i=0; i<argc; i++) {
00094            for(j=0; j<256; j++) arg[j]=' ';
00095            
00096            ifor=(fortint)i;
00097            
00098          # if defined CRAY
00099              molpro_getarg_(&ifor,arg,&lenmax);
00100          # else
00101              molpro_getarg_(&ifor,arg,lenmax);
00102          # endif
00103 
00104            for(j=0; j<256 && arg[j] != ' '; j++);
00105            arg[j] = 0;
00106            argv[i] = (char *) strdup(arg);
00107            if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("In ppidd_initialize: argc=%d, argv[%d]=%s\n",argc,i,argv[i]);
00108          }
00109       }
00110   #else
00111 /* For standalone ppidd library, disable the function of getting command line arguments. */
00112 /* Use the dummy command arguments, since MPI_Init can't work if arguments are null for MPICH1.
00113    For MPICH2 and other MPI2 library, no such limitation */
00114       argc=1;
00115       i=0;
00116       argv = malloc(argc*sizeof(char*));
00117       strcpy(arg,"DummyCommand");
00118       argv[0] = (char *) strdup(arg);
00119       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("In ppidd_initialize: USE DUMMY ARGUMENTS. argc=%d, argv[%d]=%s\n",argc,i,argv[i]);
00120   #endif
00121 
00122    /* ================ *\
00123       Initialize MPIGA
00124    \* ================ */
00125   #ifdef MPI2
00126       mpierr=mpiga_initialize(&argc,&argv);
00127       mpi_test_status("MPIGA_Initialize:",mpierr);
00128   #endif
00129   #ifdef GA_MPI
00130       MPI_Init(&argc, &argv);                       /* initialize MPI */
00131   #endif
00132 #endif
00133 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00134   #if defined(GA_TCGMSG) || defined(GA_TCGMSG_MPI)
00135 /* call fortran interface routine PBEGINF_() instead of c interface routine PBEGIN_(argc, argv) to avoid handling the arguments additionally */
00136       PBEGINF_();                                /* initialize TCGMSG */
00137   #endif
00138       GA_Initialize();                            /* initialize GA */
00139 #endif
00140 
00141    /* ================================================================== *\
00142       Free the memory for argv[i] and argv itself after having used them
00143    \* ================================================================== */
00144    /* strdup implies copying a string to a particular location that will be automatically created by the function.
00145     * The allocated memory for argv[i] needs to be explicitly freed before leaving this function */
00146 #if defined(MPI2) || defined(GA_MPI)
00147       for (i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
00148          if (argv[i]) free(argv[i]);
00149       }
00150    /* Also need to free argv itself */
00151       if (argv) free(argv);
00152   #ifdef MPI2
00153       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("%4d: In mpiga_fortran: end of mpiga_initialize.\n",mpigv(myproc));
00154   #endif
00155 #endif
00156    }
00157 
00158 
00159 //! Terminate the PPIDD parallel environment.
00160 /*!
00161  *  - For \b GA, tidy up global arrays and TCGMSG/MPI, analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_terminate
00162  *  - For \b MPI2, tidy up some associated resources and call MPI_Finalize.
00163  */
00164    void PPIDD_Finalize(void) {
00165 #ifdef MPI2
00166       mpiga_terminate();
00167 #endif
00168 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00169       GA_Terminate();
00170 #ifdef GA_MPI
00171       MPI_Finalize();
00172 #endif
00173 #if defined(GA_TCGMSG) || defined(GA_TCGMSG_MPI)
00174       PEND_();
00175 #endif
00176 #endif
00177    }

00180 /*! \cond */    
00181 /*  Detect whether MA is used for allocation of GA memory.
00182  *
00183  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_uses_ma
00184  *  - \b MPI2 always returns <tt>.false.</tt>
00185  */
00186    void PPIDD_Uses_ma(fortlogical *ok) {
00187 #ifdef MPI2
00188       *ok = FALSE;
00189 #endif
00190 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00191       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("In ppidd_uses_ma: sizeof(fortlogical)=%d, sizeof(fortint)=%d, sizeof(Integer)=%d\n",
00192                              (int)sizeof(fortlogical),(int)sizeof(fortint),(int)sizeof(Integer));
00193       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("In ppidd_uses_ma: sizeof(double)=%d,  sizeof(DoublePrecision)=%d\n",(int)sizeof(double),(int)sizeof(DoublePrecision));
00194 
00195       if (GA_Uses_ma()) *ok = TRUE;
00196       else *ok = FALSE;
00197 #endif
00198 #if !defined(MPI2) && !defined(GA_TOOLS)
00199       *ok = FALSE;
00200 #endif
00201   }
00202 
00203 
00204 /*  Initialize the memory allocator.
00205  *
00206  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/parsoft/ma/MAapi.html
00207  *  - \b MPI2 always returns <tt>.true.</tt>
00208  */
00209    void PPIDD_MA_init(fortint *dtype, fortint *stack, fortint *heap, fortlogical *ok) {
00210 #ifdef MPI2
00211       *ok = TRUE;
00212 #endif
00213 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00214       int istack=(int)*stack;
00215       int iheap=(int)*heap;
00216       int gadtype;
00217 
00218       switch((int)*dtype){
00219       case 0: 
00220               gadtype=MT_F_INT;
00221               break;
00222       case 1: 
00223               gadtype=MT_F_DBL;
00224               break;
00225       default: 
00226               GA_Error(" In PPIDD_MA_Init: wrong data type ",(int)*dtype); 
00227       }
00228       if( MA_init(gadtype, istack, iheap)) *ok = TRUE;
00229       else *ok = FALSE;
00230 #endif
00231 #if !defined(MPI2) && !defined(GA_TOOLS)
00232       *ok = TRUE;
00233 #endif
00234   }
00235 /*! \endcond */    
00236 
00237 //! Return an elapsed time on the calling process.
00238 /*!
00239  * Returns a floating-point number of seconds, representing elapsed wall-clock time since an arbitrary time in the past. 
00240  * The times returned are local to the node that called them. There is no requirement that different nodes return the same time.
00241  * This is a local operation.
00242  *
00243  *  - \b GA calls GA_Wtime, which is available only in release 4.1 or greater, http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_wtime
00244  *  - \b MPI2 calls MPI_Wtime
00245  */
00246    void PPIDD_Wtime(double *ctime) {
00247 #ifdef MPI2
00248       *ctime = MPI_Wtime();
00249 #endif
00250 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00251       *ctime = GA_Wtime();
00252 #endif
00253   }
00254 
00255 
00256 //! Print an error message and abort the program execution.
00257 /*!
00258  *  - \b GA calls GA_Error, http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_error
00259  *  - For \b MPI2, prints error, and then calls MPI_Abort.
00260  */
00261    void PPIDD_Error(char *message
00262 /*! \cond */
00263 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT)
00264                ,fortintc lx
00265 #endif
00266 /*! \endcond */
00267                ,fortint *code
00268 /*! \cond */
00269 #if defined(FORTCL_END)
00270                ,fortintc lx
00271 #endif
00272 /*! \endcond */
00273       ) {
00274       char *msg2, *p;
00275       int icode=(int)*code;
00276       int lxi;
00277       
00278 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT) || defined(FORTCL_END)
00279       lxi=(int)lx;
00280 #ifdef FORTINTC_DIVIDE
00281       lxi=(int)lx/FORTINTC_DIVIDE;
00282 #endif
00283 #else
00284       lxi=strlen(message);
00285 #endif
00286       strncpy((msg2=(char *)calloc(lxi+1,1)),message,lxi);
00287       for (p=msg2+lxi;p>=msg2;p--) if (*p==' ')*p=(char)0;
00288 
00289 #ifdef MPI2
00290       MPIGA_Error(msg2, icode);
00291 #endif
00292 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00293       GA_Error(msg2, icode);
00294 #endif
00295 #if !defined(MPI2) && !defined(GA_TOOLS)
00296     fprintf(stdout," %s %d (%#x).\n", msg2,icode,icode);
00297     fflush(stdout);
00298     fprintf(stderr," %s %d (%#x).\n", msg2,icode,icode);
00299 
00300     printf(" PPIDD_Error: now exiting...\n");
00301     exit(1);
00302 #endif
00303       free(msg2);
00304    }

00308 //! Get the next shared counter number(helper process should be enabled).
00309 /*! Increment a counter by 1 and returns the counter value (0, 1, ...). */
00310    void PPIDD_Nxtval(fortint *numproc, fortint *val) {
00311 #ifdef MPI2
00312 #ifdef NO_NXTVAL_SERVER
00313       fprintf(stderr,"%4d: ERROR: Attemp to call NXTVAL routine without helper process!\n", ProcID());
00314       MPI_Abort(mpigv(Compute_comm),911);
00315 #else
00316       int mproc = (int) *numproc;
00317       *val= (fortint) NXTVAL(&mproc);
00318 #endif
00319 #endif
00320 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00321   #if defined(GA_TCGMSG) || defined(GA_TCGMSG_MPI)
00322       long mproc = (long) *numproc;
00323       *val= (fortint) NXTVAL_(&mproc);
00324   #endif
00325 #endif
00326 }

00330 //!  Determine the total number of processes available (including helper process if there is one).
00331 /*!
00332  *  - \b GA calls GA_Nnodes,
00333  *  http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_nnodes
00334  *  - \b MPI2 calls MPI_Comm_size for communicator MPI_COMM_WORLD.
00335  */
00336    void PPIDD_Size_all(fortint *np) {
00337 #ifdef MPI2
00338       int mpinp;
00339       MPI_Comm  mpicomm=MPI_COMM_WORLD;
00340       
00341       MPI_Comm_size(mpicomm, &mpinp);
00342       *np = (fortint) mpinp;
00343 #endif
00344 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00345       *np = (fortint)GA_Nnodes();
00346 #endif
00347 #if !defined(MPI2) && !defined(GA_TOOLS)
00348       *np = (fortint)1;
00349 #endif
00350    }

00354 /*!
00355  *  - \b GA calls GA_Nnodes,
00356  *  http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_nnodes
00357  *  - \b MPI2 calls MPI_Comm_size for computational communicator.
00358  */
00359    void PPIDD_Size(fortint *np) {
00360 #ifdef MPI2
00361       int mpinp;
00362       MPI_Comm  mpicomm=mpigv(Compute_comm);
00363       
00364       MPI_Comm_size(mpicomm, &mpinp);
00365       *np = (fortint) mpinp;
00366 #endif
00367 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00368       *np = (fortint)GA_Nnodes();
00369 #endif
00370 #if !defined(MPI2) && !defined(GA_TOOLS)
00371       *np = (fortint)1;
00372 #endif
00373    }

00376 //! Determine the rank of the calling process.
00377 /*!
00378  *  - \b GA calls GA_Nodeid,
00379  *  http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_nodeid
00380  *  - \b MPI2 calls MPI_Comm_rank in computational communicator.
00381  */
00382    void PPIDD_Rank(fortint *me) {
00383 #ifdef MPI2
00384       int mpime;
00385       MPI_Comm  mpicomm=mpigv(Compute_comm);
00386       
00387       MPI_Comm_rank(mpicomm, &mpime);
00388       *me = (fortint) mpime;
00389 #endif
00390 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00391       *me = (fortint)GA_Nodeid();
00392 #endif
00393 #if !defined(MPI2) && !defined(GA_TOOLS)
00394       *me = (fortint)0;
00395 #endif
00396    }

00402  *  - \b MPI2 does nothing

00404    void PPIDD_Init_fence(void) {

00411 //! Block the calling process until all data transfers complete.
00412 /*!
00413  *  - \b GA calls GA_Fence, http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_fence
00414  *  - \b MPI2 does nothing
00415  */
00416    void PPIDD_Fence(void) {
00417 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00418       GA_Fence();
00419 #endif
00420    }

00423 
00424 #if defined(MPI2) || defined(GA_MPI)
00425 /* =================== nonblocking mpi message list ================= */
00426 #define MAX_MPIQ_LEN 128      /* Maximum no. of outstanding messages */
00427 /* In Molpro, it seems nonblocking send/recv is never used, so here set it to a small number */
00428 /*! \cond */
00429 static struct msg_mpiq_struct{
00430   MPI_Request request;
00431   long         node;
00432   long         type;
00433   long         lenbuf;
00434   long         snd;
00435   long         from;
00436 } msg_mpiq[MAX_MPIQ_LEN];
00437 /*! \endcond */    
00438 
00439 static int n_in_msg_mpiq=0;
00440 /* =================================================================== */
00441 #endif
00442 
00443 
00444 //! Blocking/nonblocking send.
00445 /*!
00446  *  - \b GA calls SND_.
00447  *  - \b MPI2 calls MPI_Send ( sync is 1) or MPI_Isend ( sync is 0).
00448  */
00449    void PPIDD_Send(void *buf,fortint *count,fortint *dtype,fortint *dest,fortint *sync) {
00450 #if defined(MPI2) || defined(GA_MPI)
00451   #ifdef MPI2
00452       MPI_Comm  mpicomm=mpigv(Compute_comm);
00453   #endif
00454   #ifdef GA_MPI
00455       MPI_Comm  mpicomm = MPI_COMM_WORLD;
00456   #endif
00457       int mpicount=(int)*count;
00458       int mpidest=(int)*dest;
00459       int mpitag=(int)*dtype;
00460       int mpisync=(int)*sync;
00461       int mpilenbuf,mpierr;
00462       MPI_Datatype mpidtype;
00463       int sizempidtype;
00464       
00465       mpiga_type_f2c((int)*dtype,&mpidtype,&sizempidtype);
00466       mpilenbuf=mpicount*sizempidtype;
00467 
00468       if (MPIGA_Debug) {
00469          printf("MPIGA_SEND: node %d sending to %d, len(bytes)=%d, mes tag=%d, sync=%d\n",
00470                  ProcID(), mpidest, mpilenbuf, mpitag, mpisync);
00471          fflush(stdout);
00472       }
00473 
00474       if (mpisync) {
00475          mpierr=MPI_Send(buf,mpilenbuf,MPI_CHAR,mpidest,mpitag,mpicomm);
00476          mpi_test_status("MPIGA_SEND: SEND:",mpierr);
00477       }
00478       else {
00479          if (n_in_msg_mpiq >= MAX_MPIQ_LEN) {
00480             MPIGA_Error("MPIGA_SEND: nonblocking SEND: overflowing async Queue limit",n_in_msg_mpiq);
00481          }
00482          mpierr = MPI_Isend(buf, mpilenbuf, MPI_CHAR,mpidest, mpitag,mpicomm,
00483                      &msg_mpiq[n_in_msg_mpiq].request);
00484          mpi_test_status("MPIGA_SEND: nonblocking SEND:",mpierr);
00485 
00486          msg_mpiq[n_in_msg_mpiq].node   =(long) mpidest;
00487          msg_mpiq[n_in_msg_mpiq].type   =(long) *dtype;
00488          msg_mpiq[n_in_msg_mpiq].lenbuf =(long) mpilenbuf;
00489          msg_mpiq[n_in_msg_mpiq].snd = (long)1;
00490       }
00491 #endif
00492 #if defined(GA_TCGMSG) || defined(GA_TCGMSG_MPI)
00493       long gadtype;
00494       long galenbuf;
00495       long gadest=(long)*dest;
00496       long gasync=(long)*sync;
00497       size_t ctype;
00498 
00499       switch((int)*dtype){
00500       case 0: 
00501               gadtype=MT_F_INT;
00502               ctype=sizeof(fortint);
00503               break;
00504       case 1: 
00505               gadtype=MT_F_DBL;
00506               ctype=sizeof(double);
00507               break;
00508       default: 
00509               GA_Error(" In ppidd_Create: wrong data type ",(int)*dtype); 
00510       }
00511       galenbuf=(*count)*ctype;
00512       SND_(&gadtype, buf, &galenbuf, &gadest, &gasync);      
00513 #endif
00514    }
00515 
00516 
00517 //! Blocking/nonblocking receive.
00518 /*!
00519  *  - \b GA calls RCV_.
00520  *  - \b MPI2 calls MPI_Recv ( sync is 1) or MPI_Irecv( sync is 0).
00521  */
00522    void PPIDD_Recv(void *buf,fortint *count,fortint *dtype,fortint *source,fortint *lenreal,fortint *sourcereal,fortint *sync) {
00523 #if defined(MPI2) || defined(GA_MPI)
00524   #ifdef MPI2
00525       MPI_Comm  mpicomm=mpigv(Compute_comm);
00526   #endif
00527   #ifdef GA_MPI
00528       MPI_Comm  mpicomm = MPI_COMM_WORLD;
00529   #endif
00530       int mpicount=(int)*count;
00531       int mpitag=(int)*dtype;
00532       int mpisource=(int)*source;
00533       int mpisync=(int)*sync;
00534       int mpinode,mpilenbuf,mpierr;
00535       MPI_Status status;
00536       MPI_Request request;
00537       MPI_Datatype mpidtype;
00538       int sizempidtype;
00539       
00540       mpiga_type_f2c((int)*dtype,&mpidtype,&sizempidtype);
00541       mpilenbuf=mpicount*sizempidtype;
00542     
00543       if (mpisource == -1)
00544          mpinode = MPI_ANY_SOURCE;
00545       else
00546          mpinode = mpisource;
00547 
00548       if (MPIGA_Debug) {
00549          printf("MPIGA_RECV: node %d receving from %d, len(bytes)=%d, mes tag=%d, sync=%d\n",
00550                  ProcID(), mpisource, mpilenbuf, mpitag, mpisync);
00551          fflush(stdout);
00552       }
00553 
00554       if(mpisync==0){
00555          if (n_in_msg_mpiq >= MAX_MPIQ_LEN) {
00556             MPIGA_Error("MPIGA_RECV: nonblocking RECV: overflowing async Queue limit", n_in_msg_mpiq);
00557          }
00558          mpierr = MPI_Irecv(buf,mpilenbuf,MPI_CHAR,mpinode,mpitag,mpicomm,&request);
00559          mpi_test_status("MPIGA_RECV: nonblocking RECV:",mpierr);
00560 
00561          *sourcereal = (fortint) mpinode;          /* Get source node  */
00562          *lenreal = (fortint) (-1);
00563          msg_mpiq[n_in_msg_mpiq].request = request;
00564          msg_mpiq[n_in_msg_mpiq].node   = (long)*source;
00565          msg_mpiq[n_in_msg_mpiq].type   = (long)*dtype;
00566          msg_mpiq[n_in_msg_mpiq].lenbuf = (long)mpilenbuf;
00567          msg_mpiq[n_in_msg_mpiq].snd = (long)0;
00568          n_in_msg_mpiq++;
00569       }
00570       else{
00571          mpierr = MPI_Recv(buf,mpilenbuf,MPI_CHAR,mpinode,mpitag,mpicomm,&status);
00572          mpi_test_status("MPIGA_RECV: RECV:",mpierr);
00573          mpierr = MPI_Get_count(&status, MPI_CHAR, &mpilenbuf);
00574          mpi_test_status("MPIGA_RECV: Get_count:",mpierr);
00575          *sourcereal = (fortint)status.MPI_SOURCE; 
00576          *lenreal    = (fortint)mpilenbuf;
00577       }
00578 #endif
00579 #if defined(GA_TCGMSG) || defined(GA_TCGMSG_MPI)
00580       long gadtype;
00581       long galenbuf;
00582       long gasource=(long)*source;
00583       long gasync=(long)*sync;
00584       long galenreal;
00585       long gasourcereal;
00586       size_t ctype;
00587 
00588       switch((int)*dtype){
00589       case 0: 
00590               gadtype=MT_F_INT;
00591               ctype=sizeof(fortint);
00592               break;
00593       case 1: 
00594               gadtype=MT_F_DBL;
00595               ctype=sizeof(double);
00596               break;
00597       default: 
00598               GA_Error(" In ppidd_recv: wrong data type ",(int)*dtype); 
00599       }
00600 
00601       galenbuf=(*count)*ctype;
00602       RCV_(&gadtype, buf, &galenbuf, &galenreal, &gasource, &gasourcereal, &gasync);
00603       *lenreal    = (fortint)galenreal;
00604       *sourcereal = (fortint)gasourcereal; 
00605 #endif
00606    }
00607 
00608 
00609 //! Wait for completion of all asynchronous send/receive.
00610 /*!
00611  * ignores nodesel !! */
00612 /*!
00613  *  - \b GA (with TCGMSG) analogous to WAITCOM
00614  *  - \b MPI2 calls MPI_Wait for all asynchronous requests.
00615  */
00616    void PPIDD_Wait(fortint *nodesel) {
00617 #if defined(MPI2) || defined(GA_MPI)
00618       int mpierr,i;
00619       MPI_Status status;
00620 
00621       for (i=0; i<n_in_msg_mpiq; i++){
00622          if (MPIGA_Debug) {
00623             printf("MPIGA_Wait: node %d waiting for msg to/from %ld, #%d\n", ProcID(), msg_mpiq[i].node, i);
00624             fflush(stdout);
00625          }
00626          mpierr = MPI_Wait(&msg_mpiq[i].request, &status);
00627          mpi_test_status("MPIGA_Wait:",mpierr);
00628       }
00629       n_in_msg_mpiq = 0;
00630 #endif
00631 #if defined(GA_TCGMSG) || defined(GA_TCGMSG_MPI)
00632       long  ganode =  (long) *nodesel;
00633       WAITCOM_(&ganode);
00634 #endif
00635    }
00636 
00637 
00638 //! Detect whether a message of the specified type is available.
00639 /*!
00640  *  - \b GA (with TCGMSG) analogous to PROBE
00641  *  - \b MPI2 calls MPI_Iprobe
00642  */
00643    void PPIDD_Iprobe(fortint *tag,fortint *source,fortlogical *ok) {
00644 #if defined(MPI2) || defined(GA_MPI)
00645   #ifdef MPI2
00646       MPI_Comm  mpicomm=mpigv(Compute_comm);
00647   #endif
00648   #ifdef GA_MPI
00649       MPI_Comm  mpicomm = MPI_COMM_WORLD;
00650   #endif
00651       int mpitag=(int)*tag;
00652       int mpisource,mpierr,flag;
00653       MPI_Status status;
00654 
00655       mpisource = (*source < 0) ? MPI_ANY_SOURCE  : (int) *source;
00656       mpierr = MPI_Iprobe(mpisource, mpitag, mpicomm, &flag, &status);
00657       mpi_test_status("MPIGA_Iprobe:",mpierr);
00658       if(flag) *ok = TRUE ;
00659       else *ok = FALSE ;
00660 #endif
00661 #if defined(GA_TCGMSG) || defined(GA_TCGMSG_MPI)
00662       long gatag=(long)*tag;
00663       long gasource=(long)*source;
00664       long gaflag;
00665       gaflag=PROBE_(&gatag, &gasource);
00666       if(gaflag) *ok = TRUE ;
00667       else *ok = FALSE ;
00668 #endif
00669    }
00670 
00671 
00672 //! Broadcast a message from the root process to all other processes.
00673 /*!
00674  *  Collective operation.
00675  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_brdcst
00676  *  - \b MPI2 calls MPI_Bcast
00677  *
00678  *  - \c type=0 : fortran integer and logical types
00679  *  - \c type=1 : fortran double precision type */
00680    void PPIDD_BCast(void *buffer,fortint *count,fortint *type,fortint *root) {
00681 #ifdef MPI2
00682       int mpicount=(int)*count;
00683       int dtype =(int)*type;
00684       int mpiroot=(int)*root;
00685       MPI_Datatype mpidtype;
00686       int sizempidtype;
00687       MPI_Comm mpicomm;
00688       int mpierr;
00689 
00690       mpiga_type_f2c(dtype,&mpidtype,&sizempidtype);
00691       mpicomm=mpigv(Compute_comm);
00692 
00693       mpierr=MPI_Bcast(buffer,mpicount,mpidtype,mpiroot,mpicomm);
00694       mpi_test_status("MPIGA_BCast:",mpierr);
00695 #endif
00696 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00697       int gacount=(int)*count;
00698       int dtype =(int)*type;
00699       int garoot=(int)*root;
00700       int galenbuf;  /* in bytes */
00701       size_t ctype;
00702 
00703       switch(dtype){
00704       case 0: 
00705               ctype=sizeof(fortint);
00706               break;
00707       case 1: 
00708               ctype=sizeof(double);
00709               break;
00710      default: 
00711               GA_Error(" In ppidd_brdcst: wrong data type ",dtype); 
00712       }
00713       galenbuf=ctype*gacount;
00714       GA_Brdcst(buffer, galenbuf, garoot);
00715 #endif
00716    }
00717 
00718 
00719 //! Synchronize processes and ensure all have reached this routine.
00720 /*!
00721  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_sync
00722  *  - \b MPI2 calls MPI_Barrier
00723  */
00724    void PPIDD_Barrier(void) {
00725 #ifdef MPI2
00726       int mpierr;
00727 
00728       mpierr=MPI_Barrier(mpigv(Compute_comm));
00729       mpi_test_status("MPIGA_Barrier:",mpierr);
00730 #endif
00731 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00732       GA_Sync();
00733 #endif
00734    }
00735 
00736 
00737 
00738 //! Combine values from all processes and distribute the result back to all processes. 
00739 /*!
00740  *  - \b GA analogous to GA_dgop and GA_igop, http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_dgop
00741  *  - For \b MPI2, it is realized by MPI_Allreduce
00742  *
00743  *  - \c type=0 : Fortran Integer
00744  *  - \c type=1 : Fortran Double Precision */
00745    void PPIDD_Gsum(fortint *type,void *buffer,fortint *len, char *op
00746 /*! \cond */
00747 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT)
00748                ,fortintc lx
00749 #endif
00750 #if defined(FORTCL_END)
00751                ,fortintc lx
00752 #endif
00753 /*! \endcond */
00754       ) {
00755       int dtype=(int)*type;
00756       char *op2, *p;
00757       int lxi;
00758 #ifdef MPI2
00759       MPI_Datatype mpidtype;
00760       int sizempidtype;
00761       int mpilen=(int)*len;
00762 #endif
00763 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00764       int buflen=(int)*len;
00765       int gadtype_f,gadtype_c;
00766 #endif
00767 
00768 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT) || defined(FORTCL_END)
00769       lxi=(int)lx;
00770 #ifdef FORTINTC_DIVIDE
00771       lxi=(int)lx/FORTINTC_DIVIDE;
00772 #endif
00773 #else
00774       lxi=strlen(op);
00775 #endif
00776       strncpy(op2=(char *)calloc(lxi+1,1),op,lxi);
00777       for (p=op2+lxi;p>=op2;p--) if (*p==' ')*p=(char)0;
00778       
00779 #ifdef MPI2
00780       mpiga_type_f2c(dtype,&mpidtype,&sizempidtype);
00781       MPI_GSum(mpidtype,buffer,mpilen, op2);
00782 #endif
00783 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00784       switch(dtype){
00785       case 0: 
00786               gadtype_f=MT_F_INT;
00787               break;
00788       case 1: 
00789               gadtype_f=MT_F_DBL;
00790               break;
00791       default:
00792               GA_Error(" In ppidd_gsum: wrong data type ",dtype); 
00793       }
00794       gadtype_c=ga_type_f2c(gadtype_f);
00795       GA_Gop(gadtype_c, buffer, buflen, op2);
00796 #endif
00797       free(op2);
00798    }
00799 
00800 
00801 
00802 
00803 //! Create an array by following the user-specified distribution and return integer handle representing the array.
00804 /*!
00805  * Irregular distributed array data are stored across the distributed processes.
00806  *  - \c datatype=0 : fortran integer and logical types
00807  *  - \c datatype=1 : fortran double precision type 
00808 
00809  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_create_irreg
00810  */
00811    void PPIDD_Create_irreg(char *name
00812 /*! \cond */
00813 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT)
00814                ,fortintc lx
00815 #endif
00816 /*! \endcond */
00817                ,fortint *lenin,fortint *nchunk,fortint *datatype,fortint *handle,fortlogical *ok
00818 /*! \cond */
00819 #if defined(FORTCL_END)
00820                ,fortintc lx
00821 #endif
00822 /*! \endcond */
00823       ) {
00824 #ifdef MPI2
00825       int *mpilenin,i,mpierr;
00826       int mpinchunk=(int)*nchunk;
00827       int dtype=(int)*datatype;
00828       MPI_Datatype mpidtype;
00829       int sizempidtype;
00830       int mpihandle;
00831       char *name2;
00832       int lxi;
00833       
00834 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT) || defined(FORTCL_END)
00835       lxi=(int)lx;
00836 #ifdef FORTINTC_DIVIDE
00837       lxi=(int)lx/FORTINTC_DIVIDE;
00838 #endif
00839 #else
00840       lxi=strlen(name);
00841 #endif
00842       strncpy((name2=(char *)malloc(lxi+1)),name,lxi);
00843       name2[lxi]=(char)0;
00844       for(i=lxi-1; (i>=0 && name2[i]==' '); i--) name2[i]=(char)0;
00845       mpilenin=(int *)malloc(mpinchunk*sizeof(int));
00846       for (i=0;i<mpinchunk;i++) mpilenin[i]=(int)lenin[i];
00847       mpiga_type_f2c(dtype,&mpidtype,&sizempidtype);
00848       mpierr=mpiga_create_irreg(name2, mpilenin, mpinchunk, mpidtype, &mpihandle);
00849       free(name2);
00850       free(mpilenin);
00851       *handle=(fortint)mpihandle;
00852       if(mpierr==0) *ok = TRUE ;
00853       else *ok = FALSE ;
00854 #endif
00855 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00856       int dtype=(int)*datatype;
00857       int gadtype;
00858       int ndim=1;
00859       int nblock=(int)*nchunk;
00860       int *dims, *block, *map;
00861       int np;
00862       int i,iad,totlen;
00863       int gahandle;
00864       char *name2;
00865       int lxi;
00866       
00867 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT) || defined(FORTCL_END)
00868       lxi=(int)lx;
00869 #ifdef FORTINTC_DIVIDE
00870       lxi=(int)lx/FORTINTC_DIVIDE;
00871 #endif
00872 #else
00873       lxi=strlen(name);
00874 #endif
00875       strncpy((name2=(char *)malloc(lxi+1)),name,lxi);
00876       name2[lxi]=(char)0;
00877       for(i=lxi-1; (i>=0 && name2[i]==' '); i--) name2[i]=(char)0;
00878 
00879       switch(dtype){
00880       case 0: 
00881               gadtype=MT_F_INT;
00882               break;
00883       case 1: 
00884               gadtype=MT_F_DBL;
00885               break;
00886       default: 
00887               GA_Error(" In PPIDD_Create_irreg: wrong data type ",dtype); 
00888       }
00889 
00890       dims=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
00891       block=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
00892       np = GA_Nnodes();
00893 /* map[np] or map[nblock] ? */
00894       map=(int *)malloc(np*sizeof(int));
00895 
00896       for(i=0;i<ndim;i++) block[i]=nblock;
00897 
00898       for(iad=0,i=0;i<nblock;i++){
00899         map[i]=iad;
00900         iad=iad+(int)lenin[i];
00901       }
00902       for(i=nblock;i<np;i++) map[i]=iad;
00903 
00904       totlen=iad;
00905       for(i=0;i<ndim;i++) dims[i]=totlen;
00906 
00907       gahandle=NGA_Create_irreg(gadtype, ndim, dims, name2, block, map);
00908 
00909       free(name2);
00910       free(dims);
00911       free(block);
00912       free(map);
00913 
00914       *handle=(fortint)gahandle;
00915       *ok = TRUE ;
00916 #endif
00917    }
00918 
00919    
00920 //! Create an array using the regular distribution model and return integer handle representing the array.
00921 /*!
00922  *  - \c datatype=0  : fortran integer and logical types
00923  *  - \c datatype=1  : fortran double precision type 
00924  *  - \c storetype=0 : Normal distributed array stored across the distributed processes
00925  *  - \c storetype>=1: Low-latency array stored on one or more helper processes (effective only when helper process is enabled). \c storetype is advisory: the underlying implementation will use up to \c storetype helpers.
00926 
00927  *  - For \b GA, storetype doesn't take effect, and data are always stored across the distributed processes, analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_create
00928  *  - For \b MPI2, the library can presently be built with zero or one (default) helpers.
00929  *       When helper process is disabled, \c storetype doesn't take effect, and data are always stored across the distributed processes.
00930  */
00931    void PPIDD_Create(char *name
00932 /*! \cond */
00933 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT)
00934                ,fortintc lx
00935 #endif
00936 /*! \endcond */
00937                ,fortint *lentot, fortint *datatype, fortint *storetype, fortint *handle, fortlogical *ok
00938 /*! \cond */
00939 #if defined(FORTCL_END)
00940                ,fortintc lx
00941 #endif
00942 /*! \endcond */
00943       ) {
00944 #ifdef MPI2
00945       int mpierr;
00946       int mpilentot=(int)*lentot;
00947       int dtype=(int)*datatype;
00948       MPI_Datatype mpidtype;
00949       int sizempidtype;
00950       int stype=(int)*storetype;
00951       int mpihandle;
00952       char *name2, *p;
00953       int lxi;
00954       
00955 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT) || defined(FORTCL_END)
00956       lxi=(int)lx;
00957 #ifdef FORTINTC_DIVIDE
00958       lxi=(int)lx/FORTINTC_DIVIDE;
00959 #endif
00960 #else
00961       lxi=strlen(name);
00962 #endif
00963       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("%4d: In PPIDD_Create: sizeof(fortint)=%d,sizeof(fortintc)=%d,sizeof(fortlogical)=%d,lxi=%d\n",
00964         mpigv(myproc),(int)sizeof(fortint),(int)sizeof(fortintc),(int)sizeof(fortlogical),lxi);
00965       strncpy((name2=(char *)calloc(lxi+1,1)),name,lxi);
00966       for (p=name2+lxi;p>=name2;p--) if (*p==' ')*p=(char)0;
00967       mpiga_type_f2c(dtype,&mpidtype,&sizempidtype);
00968 #ifdef NO_NXTVAL_SERVER
00969       mpierr=mpiga_create( name2, mpilentot, mpidtype, &mpihandle );
00970 #else
00971       if (stype==0)
00972          mpierr=mpiga_create( name2, mpilentot, mpidtype, &mpihandle );
00973       else {
00974          int mproc=0;
00975          int flag=COLFLAG;
00976          int ielem=1;
00977          mpierr=NXTVAL_helpga(mproc, flag, mpilentot, ielem, &mpihandle, name2, mpidtype);
00978       }
00979 #endif
00980       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("%4d: In PPIDD_Create: array %s created, datatype=%d, storetype=%d\n",mpigv(myproc),name2,stype,dtype);
00981          
00982       free(name2);
00983       *handle=(fortint)mpihandle;
00984       if(mpierr==0) *ok = TRUE ;
00985       else *ok = FALSE ;
00986 #endif
00987 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
00988       int dtype=(int)*datatype;
00989       int gadtype;
00990       int ndim=1;
00991       int *dims, *block;
00992       int galentot=(int)*lentot;
00993       int i;
00994       int gahandle;
00995       char *name2, *p;
00996       int lxi;
00997       
00998 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT) || defined(FORTCL_END)
00999       lxi=(int)lx;
01000 #ifdef FORTINTC_DIVIDE
01001       lxi=(int)lx/FORTINTC_DIVIDE;
01002 #endif
01003 #else
01004       lxi=strlen(name);
01005 #endif
01006       strncpy((name2=(char *)calloc(lxi+1,1)),name,lxi);
01007       for (p=name2+lxi;p>=name2;p--) if (*p==' ')*p=(char)0;
01008 
01009       switch(dtype){
01010       case 0: 
01011               gadtype=MT_F_INT;
01012               break;
01013       case 1: 
01014               gadtype=MT_F_DBL;
01015               break;
01016       default: 
01017               GA_Error(" In ppidd_Create: wrong data type ",dtype); 
01018       }
01019 
01020       dims=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01021       block=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01022 
01023       for(i=0;i<ndim;i++) block[i]=-1;
01024 
01025       for(i=0;i<ndim;i++) dims[i]=galentot;
01026 
01027       gahandle=NGA_Create(gadtype, ndim, dims, name2, block);
01028 
01029       free(name2);
01030       free(dims);
01031       free(block);
01032 
01033       *handle=(fortint)gahandle;
01034       *ok = TRUE ;
01035 #endif
01036    }
01037    
01038 
01039 //! Deallocate the array represented by handle and free any associated resources.
01040 /*!
01041  *  - \b GA analogous http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_destroy
01042  */
01043    void PPIDD_Destroy(fortint *handle,fortlogical *ok) {
01044 #ifdef MPI2
01045       int mpihandle = (int) *handle;
01046       int mpierr;
01047        
01048       if ( mpiga_inquire_storetype(mpihandle) == 0 ) 
01049          mpierr=mpiga_free(mpihandle);
01050       else {
01051          int mproc=-NProcs_Work();
01052          int flag=COLFLAG;
01053          int nelem_valput=1;
01054          int ielem=1;
01055          char name[]="No";
01056          MPI_Datatype mpidtype=MPI_CHAR;
01057          mpierr=NXTVAL_helpga(mproc, flag, nelem_valput, ielem, &mpihandle, name, mpidtype);
01058       }
01059       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("%4d: In PPIDD_Destroy: array %d destroyed!\n",mpigv(myproc),mpihandle);
01060       if(mpierr==0) *ok = TRUE ;
01061       else *ok = FALSE ;
01062 #endif
01063 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01064       int ihandle = (int) *handle;
01065       GA_Destroy(ihandle);
01066       *ok = TRUE ;
01067 #endif
01068    }
01069 
01070 
01071 //! Return the range of a distributed array held by a specified process.
01072 /*!
01073  *  Return <tt>.true.</tt> if successful, otherwise <tt>.false.</tt> 
01074  *  If no array elements are owned by the process, the range is returned as [0,-1]. 
01075  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_distribution
01076  */
01077    void PPIDD_Distrib(fortint *handle,fortint *rank,fortint *ilo,fortint *ihi,fortlogical *ok) {
01078 #ifdef MPI2
01079       int mpihandle=(int)*handle;
01080       int mpirank=(int)*rank;
01081       int mpiilo;
01082       int mpiihi;
01083       int mpierr;
01084 
01085       mpierr=mpiga_distribution( mpihandle, mpirank, &mpiilo, &mpiihi);
01086       
01087       *ilo = (fortint) mpiilo;
01088       *ihi = (fortint) mpiihi;
01089       if(mpierr==0) *ok = TRUE ;
01090       else *ok = FALSE ;
01091 #endif
01092 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01093       int gahandle=(int)*handle;
01094       int garank=(int)*rank;
01095       int ndim=1;
01096       int *gailo;
01097       int *gaihi;
01098       int ARRAY_BASE=0;
01099 
01100       gailo=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01101       gaihi=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01102       NGA_Distribution(gahandle, garank, gailo, gaihi);
01103 /* If no array elements are owned by process iproc, the range is returned as lo[ ]=0 and hi[ ]= -1 for all dimensions. */
01104       if (gailo[0]<=gaihi[0]) {
01105          *ilo = (fortint) (gailo[0] + 1 - ARRAY_BASE);
01106          *ihi = (fortint) (gaihi[0] + 1 - ARRAY_BASE);
01107       }
01108       else {
01109          *ilo = (fortint) (gailo[0]);
01110          *ihi = (fortint) (gaihi[0]);
01111       }
01112       free(gailo);
01113       free(gaihi);
01114       *ok = TRUE ;
01115 #endif
01116    }
01117 
01118 
01119 
01120 //! Return a list of the processes that hold the data.
01121 /*!
01122  *  Parts of the specified patch might be actually 'owned' by several processes.
01123  *  np is the number of processes hold tha data (return 0  if ilo/ihi are out of bounds "0"). 
01124  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_locate_region
01125  */
01126    void PPIDD_Location(fortint *handle,     //!< array handle
01127                        fortint *ilo,        //!< lower element subscript, 1 (not 0) for fisrt element
01128                        fortint *ihi,        //!< higher element subscript
01129                        fortint *map,        //!< return start/end index for \c proclist
01130                        fortint *proclist,   //!< proc id list
01131                        fortint *np,         //!< proc number
01132                        fortlogical *ok      //!< return \c .true. if successful; otherwise \c .false.
01133    ) {
01134 #ifdef MPI2
01135       int mpihandle=(int)*handle;
01136       int mpiilo=(int)*ilo;
01137       int mpiihi=(int)*ihi;
01138       int mpisize,mpinp;
01139       int *mpimap,*mpiproclist;
01140       int mpierr,i;
01141       MPI_Comm mpicomm;
01142      
01143       if ( mpiga_inquire_storetype(mpihandle) == 0 ) { 
01144          mpicomm=mpigv(Compute_comm);
01145          MPI_Comm_size(mpicomm, &mpisize);
01146          mpimap=(int *)malloc(2*mpisize*sizeof(int));
01147          mpiproclist=(int *)malloc(mpisize*sizeof(int));
01148      
01149          mpierr=mpiga_location( mpihandle, mpiilo, mpiihi, mpimap, mpiproclist, &mpinp);
01150         
01151          for (i=0;i<mpinp;i++) {
01152             map[2*i]=(fortint)mpimap[2*i]; 
01153             map[2*i+1]=(fortint)mpimap[2*i+1]; 
01154             proclist[i]=(fortint)mpiproclist[i]; 
01155          }
01156          *np = (fortint) mpinp;
01157          free(mpimap);
01158          free(mpiproclist);
01159          if(mpierr==0) *ok = TRUE ;
01160          else *ok = FALSE ;
01161       }
01162       else {
01163          MPIGA_Error("PPIDD_Location: invalid storetype, should be 0. handle=",mpihandle);
01164       }
01165 #endif
01166 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01167       int mpihandle=(int)*handle;
01168       int *mpiilo;
01169       int *mpiihi;
01170       int mpisize,mpinp;
01171       int *mpimap,*mpiproclist;
01172       int i;
01173       int ARRAY_BASE=0;
01174       int ndim=1;
01175      
01176       mpisize = GA_Nnodes();
01177       mpimap=(int *)malloc(2*mpisize*sizeof(int));
01178       mpiproclist=(int *)malloc(mpisize*sizeof(int));
01179 
01180       mpiilo=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01181       mpiihi=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01182       mpiilo[0]=(int)*ilo-1+ARRAY_BASE;
01183       mpiihi[0]=(int)*ihi-1+ARRAY_BASE;
01184       mpinp=NGA_Locate_region( mpihandle, mpiilo, mpiihi, mpimap, mpiproclist);      
01185      
01186       for (i=0;i<mpinp;i++) {
01187          map[2*i]=(fortint)(mpimap[2*i]+1-ARRAY_BASE); 
01188          map[2*i+1]=(fortint)(mpimap[2*i+1]+1-ARRAY_BASE); 
01189          proclist[i]=(fortint)mpiproclist[i]; 
01190       }
01191       *np = (fortint) mpinp;
01192       free(mpimap);
01193       free(mpiproclist);
01194       free(mpiilo);
01195       free(mpiihi);
01196       *ok = TRUE ;
01197 #endif
01198    }
01199 
01200 
01201 //! Copies data from array section to the local array buffer according to starting and ending index.
01202 /*!
01203  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_get
01204  */
01205    void PPIDD_Get(fortint *handle,fortint *ilo,fortint *ihi,void *buff,fortlogical *ok) {
01206 #ifdef MPI2
01207       int mpihandle=(int)*handle;
01208       int mpiilo=(int)*ilo;
01209       int mpiihi=(int)*ihi;
01210       int mpierr;
01211      
01212       if ( mpiga_inquire_storetype(mpihandle) == 0 ) 
01213          mpierr=mpiga_get(mpihandle, mpiilo, mpiihi, buff); 
01214       else {
01215          int mproc=0;
01216          int ielem=mpiilo;
01217          int val;
01218          MPI_Datatype dtype=NXTVAL_helpga_inquire_dtype(mpihandle);
01219          if ( (mpiilo==mpiihi) && (dtype==MPI_INT||dtype==MPI_LONG||dtype==MPI_LONG_LONG) ) { /* PPIDD_helpga_get_inum */
01220             int flag=RMAFLAG;
01221             int nelem_valput=1;
01222             fortint *ibuff;
01223             
01224             val=NXTVAL_helpga_one(mproc, flag, nelem_valput, ielem, &mpihandle);
01225             ibuff=(fortint *)buff;
01226             *ibuff=(fortint)val;
01227          }
01228          else if (mpiilo <= mpiihi) { /* PPIDD_helpga_get */
01229             int flag=ETRFLAG;
01230             int nelem=mpiihi-mpiilo+1;
01231             
01232             val=NXTVAL_helpga_extra(mproc, flag, nelem, ielem, &mpihandle,buff);
01233          }
01234          else {
01235             MPIGA_Error("PPIDD_Get: starting index > ending index, handle=",mpihandle);
01236          }
01237          mpierr=0;
01238       }
01239       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("%4d: In PPIDD_Get: Get value from array handle= %d [%d--%d].\n",mpigv(myproc),mpihandle,mpiilo,mpiihi);
01240       if(mpierr==0) *ok = TRUE ;
01241       else *ok = FALSE ;
01242 #endif
01243 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01244       int mpihandle=(int)*handle;
01245       int ld[1]={1};
01246       int ndim=1;
01247       int *mpiilo;
01248       int *mpiihi;
01249       int ARRAY_BASE=0;
01250 
01251       mpiilo=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01252       mpiihi=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01253       mpiilo[0]=(int)*ilo-1+ARRAY_BASE;
01254       mpiihi[0]=(int)*ihi-1+ARRAY_BASE;
01255       NGA_Get(mpihandle, mpiilo, mpiihi, buff, ld);
01256       free(mpiilo);
01257       free(mpiihi);
01258       *ok = TRUE ;
01259 #endif
01260    }
01261 
01262 //! Put local buffer data into a section of a global array according to starting and ending index.
01263 /*!
01264  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_put
01265  */
01266    void PPIDD_Put(fortint *handle,fortint *ilo,fortint *ihi,void *buff,fortlogical *ok) {
01267 #ifdef MPI2
01268       int mpihandle=(int)*handle;
01269       int mpiilo=(int)*ilo;
01270       int mpiihi=(int)*ihi;
01271       int mpierr;
01272      
01273       if ( mpiga_inquire_storetype(mpihandle) == 0 ) 
01274          mpierr=mpiga_put(mpihandle, mpiilo, mpiihi, buff); 
01275       else {
01276          int mproc=-NProcs_Work();
01277          int ielem=mpiilo;
01278          int val;
01279          MPI_Datatype dtype=NXTVAL_helpga_inquire_dtype(mpihandle);
01280          if ( (mpiilo==mpiihi) && (dtype==MPI_INT||dtype==MPI_LONG||dtype==MPI_LONG_LONG) ) { /* PPIDD_helpga_put_inum */
01281             int flag=RMAFLAG;
01282             int valput;
01283             fortint *ibuff;
01284 
01285             ibuff=(fortint *)buff;
01286             valput=(int)*ibuff;
01287             val=NXTVAL_helpga_one(mproc, flag, valput, ielem, &mpihandle);
01288          }
01289          else if (mpiilo <= mpiihi) { /* PPIDD_helpga_put */
01290             int flag=ETRFLAG;
01291             int nelem=mpiihi-mpiilo+1;
01292             
01293             val=NXTVAL_helpga_extra(mproc, flag, nelem, ielem, &mpihandle,buff);
01294          }
01295          else {
01296             MPIGA_Error("PPIDD_Put: starting index > ending index, handle=",mpihandle);
01297          }
01298          mpierr=0;
01299       }
01300       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("%4d: In PPIDD_Put: Put buff numbers to array handle=%d [%d--%d].\n",mpigv(myproc),mpihandle,mpiilo,mpiihi);
01301       if(mpierr==0) *ok = TRUE ;
01302       else *ok = FALSE ;
01303 #endif
01304 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01305       int mpihandle=(int)*handle;
01306       int ld[1]={1};
01307       int ndim=1;
01308       int *mpiilo;
01309       int *mpiihi;
01310       int ARRAY_BASE=0;
01311      
01312       mpiilo=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01313       mpiihi=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01314       mpiilo[0]=(int)*ilo-1+ARRAY_BASE;
01315       mpiihi[0]=(int)*ihi-1+ARRAY_BASE;
01316       NGA_Put(mpihandle, mpiilo, mpiihi, buff, ld);
01317       free(mpiilo);
01318       free(mpiihi);
01319       *ok = TRUE ;
01320 #endif
01321    }

01323 
01324 //! Accumulate data into a section of a global array.
01325 /*!
01326  * Atomic operation.  global array section (ilo, ihi) += *fac * buffer
01327  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_acc
01328  */
01329    void PPIDD_Acc(fortint *handle,fortint *ilo,fortint *ihi,void *buff,void *fac,fortlogical *ok) {
01330 #ifdef MPI2
01331       int mpihandle=(int)*handle;
01332       int mpiilo=(int)*ilo;
01333       int mpiihi=(int)*ihi;
01334       int mpierr;
01335      
01336       if ( mpiga_inquire_storetype(mpihandle) == 0 ) 
01337          mpierr=mpiga_acc(mpihandle, mpiilo, mpiihi, buff, fac); 
01338       else {
01339          if (mpiilo <= mpiihi) { /* PPIDD_helpga_acc */
01340             int mproc=NProcs_Work();
01341             int ielem=mpiilo;
01342             int flag=ETRFLAG;
01343             int nelem=mpiihi-mpiilo+1;
01344             int val;
01345             
01346             val=NXTVAL_helpga_extra_acc(mproc, flag, nelem, ielem, &mpihandle, buff, fac);
01347          }
01348          else {
01349             MPIGA_Error("PPIDD_Put: starting index > ending index, handle=",mpihandle);
01350          }
01351          mpierr=0;
01352       }
01353       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("%4d: In PPIDD_Acc: Accumulate buff numbers to array handle=%d [%d--%d].\n",mpigv(myproc),mpihandle,mpiilo,mpiihi);
01354       if(mpierr==0) *ok = TRUE ;
01355       else *ok = FALSE ;
01356 #endif
01357 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01358       int mpihandle=(int)*handle;
01359       int ld[1]={1};
01360       int ndim=1;
01361       int *mpiilo;
01362       int *mpiihi;
01363       int ARRAY_BASE=0;
01364      
01365       mpiilo=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01366       mpiihi=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01367       mpiilo[0]=(int)*ilo-1+ARRAY_BASE;
01368       mpiihi[0]=(int)*ihi-1+ARRAY_BASE;
01369       NGA_Acc(mpihandle, mpiilo, mpiihi, buff, ld, fac);
01370       free(mpiilo);
01371       free(mpiihi);
01372       *ok = TRUE ;
01373 #endif
01374    }

01376 
01377 //! Atomically read and increment an element in an integer array.
01378 /*! Reads data from the (inum) element of a global array of integers, returns that value, and increments the (inum)
01379     element by a given increment. This is a fetch-and-add operation.
01380  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_read_inc
01381  */
01382    void PPIDD_Read_inc(fortint *ihandle,fortint *inum,fortint *incr,fortint *returnval) {
01383 #ifdef MPI2
01384       int mpihandle = (int) *ihandle;
01385       int mpiinum = (int) *inum;
01386       int mpiincr = (int) *incr;
01387       int mpivalue;
01388 
01389       if ( mpiga_inquire_storetype(mpihandle) == 0 ) 
01390          mpivalue=mpiga_read_inc(mpihandle,mpiinum,mpiincr);
01391       else {                                              /* PPIDD_helpga_readinc */
01392          int mproc=NProcs_Work();
01393          int flag=RMAFLAG;
01394          
01395          mpivalue=NXTVAL_helpga_one(mproc, flag, mpiincr, mpiinum, &mpihandle);
01396       }
01397       *returnval=(fortint)mpivalue;
01398       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("%4d: In PPIDD_Read_inc: fetch-and-add element[%d] of array handle=%d by increment=%d\n",
01399                             mpigv(myproc),mpiinum,mpihandle,mpiincr);
01400 #endif
01401 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01402       int handle = (int) *ihandle;
01403       int ndim=1;
01404       int *mpiinum;
01405       long gaincr = (long) *incr;
01406       long gavalue;
01407       int ARRAY_BASE=0;
01408 
01409       mpiinum=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01410       mpiinum[0] = (int) *inum-1+ARRAY_BASE;
01411       gavalue=NGA_Read_inc(handle,mpiinum, gaincr);
01412       free(mpiinum);
01413       *returnval=(fortint)gavalue;
01414 #endif
01415    }

01422    void PPIDD_Zero_patch(fortint *ihandle,fortint *ilo,fortint *ihi) {

01426       int mpiihi = (int) *ihi;

01429          mpierr=mpiga_zero_patch(mpihandle,mpiilo,mpiihi);
01430       else
01431          MPIGA_Error("PPIDD_Zero_patch: invalid storetype, should be 0. handle=",mpihandle);
01432 
01433       if(mpierr!=0) MPI_Abort(mpigv(Compute_comm),911);
01434 #endif
01435 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01436       int handle = (int) *ihandle;

01438       int *mpiilo;
01439       int *mpiihi;
01440       int ARRAY_BASE=0;
01441      
01442       mpiilo=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01443       mpiihi=(int *)malloc(ndim*sizeof(int));
01444       mpiilo[0]=(int)*ilo-1+ARRAY_BASE;
01445       mpiihi[0]=(int)*ihi-1+ARRAY_BASE;
01446 
01447       NGA_Zero_patch (handle, mpiilo, mpiihi);
01448       free(mpiilo);
01449       free(mpiihi);
01450 #endif
01451    }

01453 
01454 //! Set all the elements of an array to zero.
01455 /*!
01456  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_zero
01457  */
01458    void PPIDD_Zero(fortint *handle,fortlogical *ok) {
01459 #ifdef MPI2
01460       int mpihandle = (int) *handle;
01461       int mpierr;
01462 
01463       if ( mpiga_inquire_storetype(mpihandle) == 0 ) 
01464          mpierr=mpiga_zero(mpihandle);
01465       else {
01466          int mproc=NProcs_Work();
01467          int flag=COLFLAG;
01468          int nelem_valput=1;
01469          int ielem=1;
01470          char name[]="No";
01471          MPI_Datatype mpidtype=MPI_CHAR;
01472          mpierr=NXTVAL_helpga(mproc, flag, nelem_valput, ielem, &mpihandle, name, mpidtype);
01473       }
01474       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("%4d: In PPIDD_Zero: array %d has been set to zero.\n",mpigv(myproc),mpihandle);
01475       if (mpierr==0) *ok = TRUE ;
01476       else *ok = FALSE ;
01477 #endif
01478 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01479       int ihandle = (int) *handle;
01480       GA_Zero(ihandle);
01481       *ok = TRUE ;
01482 #endif
01483    }
01484 
01485 
01486 //! Create a new array by applying all the properties of another existing array.
01487 /*!
01488  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_duplicate
01489  *  - \b MPI2  does nothing
01490  */
01491    void PPIDD_Duplicate(fortint *handlei, fortint *handlej, char *name
01492 /*! \cond */    
01493 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT) || defined(FORTCL_END)
01494                ,fortintc lx
01495 #endif
01496 /*! \endcond */    
01497       ) {
01498 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01499       int ga_a=(int)*handlei;
01500       int ga_b;
01501       char *name2, *p;
01502       int lxi;
01503       
01504 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT) || defined(FORTCL_END)
01505       lxi=(int)lx;
01506 #ifdef FORTINTC_DIVIDE
01507       lxi=(int)lx/FORTINTC_DIVIDE;
01508 #endif
01509 #else
01510       lxi=strlen(name);
01511 #endif
01512       strncpy((name2=(char *)calloc(lxi+1,1)),name,lxi);
01513       for (p=name2+lxi;p>=name2;p--) if (*p==' ')*p=(char)0;
01514       ga_b = GA_Duplicate(ga_a, name2);
01515       free(name2);
01516       *handlej=(fortint)ga_b;
01517 #endif
01518 }
01519 
01520 
01521 //! Returns the name of a global array represented by the handle.
01522 
01523 /*!
01524  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_inquire_name
01525  *  - \c This operation is local. 
01526  */
01527    void PPIDD_Inquire_name(fortint *handle, char *name
01528 /*! \cond */    
01529 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT) || defined(FORTCL_END)
01530                ,fortintc lx
01531 #endif
01532 /*! \endcond */    
01533       ) {
01534 #ifdef MPI2
01535       char *name2;
01536       int lxi;
01537       int i,len_actual;
01538       int mpihandle = (int) *handle;
01539       
01540 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT) || defined(FORTCL_END)
01541       lxi=(int)lx;
01542 #ifdef FORTINTC_DIVIDE
01543       lxi=(int)lx/FORTINTC_DIVIDE;
01544 #endif
01545 #else
01546       lxi=strlen(name);
01547 #endif
01548       if ( mpiga_inquire_storetype(mpihandle) == 0 ) 
01549          mpiga_inquire_name(mpihandle, &name2);
01550       else {
01551          NXTVAL_helpga_inquire_name(mpihandle, &name2);
01552       }
01553       len_actual=strlen(name2);
01554       strncpy(name,name2,len_actual); 
01555       for(i=len_actual;i<lxi;i++) name[i]=' '; 
01556       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("In PPIDD_Inquire_name: name2=%s,strlen(name2)=%d,lxi=%d\n",name2,len_actual,lxi);
01557 #endif
01558 
01559 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01560       char *name2;
01561       int lxi;
01562       int i,len_actual;
01563       int gahandle = (int) *handle;
01564       
01565 #if defined(FORTCL_NEXT) || defined(FORTCL_END)
01566       lxi=(int)lx;
01567 #ifdef FORTINTC_DIVIDE
01568       lxi=(int)lx/FORTINTC_DIVIDE;
01569 #endif
01570 #else
01571       lxi=strlen(name);
01572 #endif
01573 /*      strcpy(name2=malloc(80*sizeof(char)),GA_Inquire_name(gahandle));
01574       strncpy(name,name2,strlen(name2)); */
01575       name2=GA_Inquire_name(gahandle);
01576       len_actual=strlen(name2);
01577       strncpy(name,name2,len_actual);
01578       for(i=len_actual;i<lxi;i++) name[i]=' '; 
01579       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("In PPIDD_Inquire_name: name2=%s,strlen(name2)=%d,lxi=%d\n",name2,len_actual,lxi);
01580 #endif
01581 }
01582 
01583 
01584 //! Returns the storetype of a global array represented by the handle.
01585 
01586 /*!
01587  *     storetype: number of helper processes for storing this global array.
01588  *  - \c storetype=0 : Normal distributed array stored across the distributed processes
01589  *  - \c storetype>=1: Low-latency array stored on one or more helper processes (effective only when helper process is enabled).
01590  *  - \c This operation is local. 
01591  */
01592    void PPIDD_Inquire_stype(fortint *handle, fortint *storetype) {
01593 #ifdef MPI2
01594       int mpihandle = (int) *handle;
01595       *storetype=(fortint)mpiga_inquire_storetype(mpihandle);
01596 #endif
01597 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01598       *storetype=(fortint)0;
01599 #endif
01600    }
01601 
01602 
01603 //! Get the amount of memory (in bytes) used in the allocated distributed arrays on the calling processor.
01604 /*!
01605  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_inquire_memory
01606  */
01607    void PPIDD_Inquire_mem(fortint *mem_used) {
01608 #ifdef MPI2
01609       long localmem;
01610       localmem=mpiga_localmem();
01611       *mem_used=(fortint)localmem;
01612 #endif
01613 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01614       size_t localmem;
01615       localmem=GA_Inquire_memory();
01616       *mem_used=(fortint)localmem;
01617 #endif
01618    }
01619 
01620 
01621 
01622 //! Create a set of mutex variables that can be used for mutual exclusion.
01623 /*!
01624  *  Returns <tt>.true.</tt> if the operation succeeded or <tt>.false.</tt> when failed. It is a collective operation. 
01625 
01626  *  - For \b GA, \c storetype doesn't take effect, analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_create_mutexes
01627  *  - For \b MPI2, there are two kinds of mutexes: 
01628  *   - (1) \c storetype=0: mutex data will be stored by a global array across the distributed processes.
01629  *        Due to the poor performance of MPI-2 one-sided communication, this kind of mutex is very slow.
01630  *   - (2) \c storetype=1: mutex data will be stored on the helper process. Improve the performance of (1), but still use MPI-2 one-sided communication.
01631  *        It might still be slow when remote process is busy.
01632  *
01633  *   When helper process is disabled, \c storetype doesn't take effect, and mutex data are always stored across the distributed processes.
01634 
01635  */
01636    void PPIDD_Create_mutexes(fortint *storetype,fortint *number,fortlogical *ok) {
01637 #ifdef MPI2
01638       int stype     = (int) *storetype;
01639       int mpinumber = (int) *number;
01640       int mpierr;
01641      
01642 #ifdef NO_NXTVAL_SERVER
01643       mpierr=mpiga_create_mutexes(mpinumber);      /* mutexes data store by a global array across the distributed processes */
01644 #else
01645       if (stype==0)
01646          mpierr=mpiga_create_mutexes(mpinumber);      /* mutexes data store by a global array across the distributed processes */
01647       else
01648          mpierr=mpi_allocate_helpmutexes(mpinumber);  /* mutexes data on helper process */
01649 #endif
01650          
01651       if(mpierr==0) *ok = TRUE ;
01652       else *ok = FALSE ;
01653 #endif
01654 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01655       int mpinumber = (int) *number;
01656       int mpierr;
01657       mpierr=GA_Create_mutexes(mpinumber);
01658 /* This is one of exceptions in GA (see global/src/capi.c) : Returns [1] if the operation succeeded or [0] when failed */
01659       if(mpierr==1) *ok = TRUE ;
01660       else *ok = FALSE ;
01661       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("In PPIDD_Create_Mutexes: mpierr=%d, ok=%d.\n",mpierr,(int)*ok);
01662 #endif
01663    }
01664 
01665 
01666 //! Lock a mutex object identified by a given mutex number.
01667 /*!
01668  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_lock
01669  */
01670    void PPIDD_Lock_mutex(fortint *inum) {
01671 #ifdef MPI2
01672       int mpiinum = (int) *inum;
01673       int mpierr;
01674       if ( mpigv(nmutex) > 0 )
01675          mpierr=mpiga_lock_mutex(mpiinum);   /* mutexes data store by a global array across the distributed processes */
01676       else
01677          mpierr=mpi_lock_helpmutex(mpiinum); /* mutexes data on helper process */
01678       if(mpierr!=0) MPI_Abort(mpigv(Compute_comm),911);
01679 #endif
01680 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01681       int mpiinum = (int) *inum;
01682       GA_Lock(mpiinum);
01683 #endif
01684    }
01685 
01686 
01687 //! Unlock  a mutex object identified by a given mutex number.
01688 /*!
01689  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_unlock
01690  */
01691    void PPIDD_Unlock_mutex(fortint *inum) {
01692 #ifdef MPI2
01693       int mpiinum = (int) *inum;
01694       int mpierr;
01695       if ( mpigv(nmutex) > 0 )
01696          mpierr=mpiga_unlock_mutex(mpiinum);    /* mutexes data store by a global array across the distributed processes */
01697       else
01698          mpierr=mpi_unlock_helpmutex(mpiinum);  /* mutexes data on helper process */
01699       if(mpierr!=0) MPI_Abort(mpigv(Compute_comm),911);
01700 #endif
01701 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01702       int mpiinum = (int) *inum;
01703       GA_Unlock(mpiinum);
01704 #endif
01705    }
01706 
01707 
01708 //! Destroy the set of mutexes created with PPIDD_Create_mutexes.
01709 /*!
01710  * Returns <tt>.true.</tt> if the operation succeeded or <tt>.false.</tt> when failed. This is a collective operation.
01711  *  - \b GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_destroy_mutexes
01712  */
01713    void PPIDD_Destroy_mutexes(fortlogical *ok) {
01714 #ifdef MPI2
01715       int mpierr;
01716       if ( mpigv(nmutex) > 0 )
01717          mpierr=mpiga_destroy_mutexes();  /* mutexes data store by a global array across the distributed processes */
01718       else
01719          mpierr=mpi_free_helpmutexes();   /* mutexes data on helper process */
01720       if(mpierr==0) *ok = TRUE ;
01721       else *ok = FALSE ;
01722 #endif
01723 #ifdef GA_TOOLS
01724       int mpierr;
01725       mpierr=GA_Destroy_mutexes();
01726 /* This is one of exceptions in GA (see global/src/capi.c) : Returns [1] if the operation succeeded or [0] when failed */
01727       if(mpierr==1) *ok = TRUE ;
01728       else *ok = FALSE ;
01729       if(MPIGA_Debug)printf("In PPIDD_Destroy_Mutexes: mpierr=%d, ok=%d.\n",mpierr,(int)*ok);
01730 #endif
01731    }
